42c027e4ff9730fbb3de84c1af0d2c506e41c3e4: Arrrr, listen close me hearties! Young swashbuckler Daniel Radcliffe, the lad what plays Harry Potter, has just turned 18 and laid claim to a treasure trove o' £20 million! But never fear, matey, he be havin' no intentions o' blowin' it all on frivolous booty. He's had enough o' playin' the Chosen One, finishin' up filmIN' on the fifth Potter flick and lookin' to set sail fer new cinematic adventures. A party he'll have, aye, but he be wantin' to keep a weather eye on his reputation, avoidin' the curse o' the "kid star goes off the rails" scurvy dog image. Savvy?
ee8871b15c50d0db17b0179a6d2beab35065f1e9: Arrr, ye landlubbers! Yer lookin' fer a summary o' that there article, eh? Alright then, listen close and I'll tell ye o' the troubles in Miami's jail. It seems many a poor soul be languishin' behind bars, awaitin' trial fer crimes that be avoidable, all while strugglin' with the scurvy o' mental illness. A fair-minded judge be speakin' out, sayin' that the arrest process itself be makin' these poor devils' conditions worse. But never fear, matey! A new mental health facility be set to drop anchor in 2008, aimin' to treat these afflicted swashbucklers rather than just lockin' 'em up and throwin' away the key. Savvy?
24521a2abb2e1f5e34e6824e0f9e56904a2b0e88: Arrr, ye landlubbers! Yer lookin' fer a summary o' the article about President Bush's colon, eh? Alright then, listen close and I'll tell ye the tale. It seems the doc's went diggin' around in the President's innards and found 5 wee polyps hidin' in his colon, like barnacles on a sunken ship. But never fear, matey, none o' them scurvy growths seemed worrisome, so the President be in good spirits, ready to hoist the sails and set sail fer Camp David once more. And it seems this ain't the first time the doc's have had to remove these pesky polyps, either - they've been doin' it fer years, even afore he took the helm o' the presidency, savvy?
06352019a19ae31e527f37f7571c6dd7f0c5da37: Arrrr, ye landlubbers! Yer lookin' fer a summary o' the bridge collapse, eh? Alright then, listen close and I'll tell ye o' the calamity that befell the poor souls crossin' that cursed bridge. 'Twas a sudden and dreadful collapse, sendin' vehicles tumblin' into the drink like so many toys in a stormy sea! Survivors be tellin' tales o' chaos and destruction, with the injured and young swabbies - schoolchildren, no less! - needin' rescue from the jaws o' death. And some o' the vehicles, me hearties, landed upside down, with passengers trapped and fearin' the worst, their lives hangin' by a thread like a ship in a ragin' gale! Yer can't imagine the terror, matey...
